title: Newly Built Modernist Abode in Los Angeles Hitting Market for $14.5M
text:
A newly constructed house in the historic Outpost Estates neighborhood in Los Angeles is coming onto the market for $14.5 million, Mansion Global has learned.



Designed by local architect Marc Whipple, the three-story house features a clean-lined modernist style while maintaining warmth. It also boasts a seamless blend of indoor and outdoor living, according to Steven Rothstein and John Iglar of Douglas Elliman, who plan to list the property on Tuesday.



“Since it’s built ground-up, the house is sized to the site on a promontory—instead of lining the street— to maximize the view,” Mr. Iglar said.

From the private gate on Los Tilos Road, one can drive on a bridge/driveway to the rooftop, which can accommodate up to 10 cars and offers unobstructed views from the Hollywood sign to the Pacific Ocean.



A main stairway or elevator leads to the first level, which is dedicated to entertaining. It features an open-floor plan with a living room, a dining room and a state-of-the-art kitchen, all opening to one of three terraces or the Zen garden outdoors. The additional 5,000 square feet of outdoor living space on this level includes a lounge area with a fire pit.



The middle level offers a second living room as well as three of the home’s five bedrooms, including a luxurious master suite which has floating glass walls on three sides and opens to an infinity pool outside. “It’s dreamy at night, with city lights twinkling outside,” Mr. Iglar said.

The lower level includes a theater, a wine cellar, a gym, two more bedrooms and a garden patio. In total, the interior encompasses approximately 8,000 square feet of living space.



The developer, Los Tilos Properties LLC, purchased the property with an old house on it for $2.3 million in 2015, property records show.
